subject: And Here's Petyr
event: The big casting news I was hinting about yesterday broke even before I finished hinting, in THE HOLLYWOOD REPORTER: http://livefeed.hollywoodreporter.com/2010/07/game-of-thrones-casts-wire-veteran.html So there you have it. Petyr Baelish, master of coin for the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, will be played by the amazing Irish actor AIDAN GILLEN. (("Big news about a small digit," get it?)) Gillen is best known to American audiences for his superb turn on THE WIRE, where he played Tommy Carcetti, an ambitious city councilman who runs for mayor for Baltimore... and loses most of his ideals along the way. Carcetti was a brilliantly written character, and Gillen played him brilliantly, painting a vivid picture of a charming, intelligent, well intentioned man slowly seduced by power. And he did it all with a Baltimore accent that was so convincing that I never doubted for a moment that he was American... and was startled to learn, when he first came in to read for Littlefinger, that he was actually Dublin born and presently lives in London. British audiences knew him first for his role as Stuart Alan Jones in QUEER AS FOLK, but he has extensive credits in both television and stage. He's a winner of the IFTA (Irish Film and Television Award), and has been nominated for a BAFTA and a Tony. He should make for a perfect Littlefinger, and I look forward eagerly to seeing what he does with the role.

comments.upictitle: Dance, baby, dance like the world is ending!: Quills
comments.article: This is definitely the best news ever. :)
Thats so awesome. I can't think of a better choice.

Hm. I could see Jaime and D'Angelo, but there's also a bit of Stringer Bell to him (esp. the way we go from seeing him as a heartless murderer to a main sympathetic character).

Now of course I'm lining up Wire/ASoIaF character pairings. Bunny Colvin and Eddard Stark. Tyrion and...Bubs, maybe? Kima or Snoop as Asha Greyjoy? Syrio as Brother Mouzone?

Most importantly, who's Omar's double?

Anyone who knows both sets of characters, I'd be interested to hear your picks...

I always catch myself measuring the actors up to the image I have of them in my head and can only guess that you must as well.  How are they in relation to what you were picturing when you were writing the books?  I would think it has to be exciting when an actor really fits what you'd envisioned and possibly frustrating when they don't.

One of my favorite characters from A Game of Thrones played by one of the best actors on "The Wire"?

I'm going to sally forth to my happy place now. *grin*

Bravo, HBO and Game of Thrones.

I'm sure Dominic West would be happy to sit in as Euron Crow's-Eye if you asked nicely.
PERFECT
I kept thinking of a younger Saul Rubinek sort of character, but this is _extraordinarily_ good casting.

It's always fun when someone you never would have thought of in a million years is cast in a role you love and it's suddenly gobsmackingly obvious how perfect they are for it.

He was freaking amazing in The Wire, one of my favorite characters on the show, and I didn't know until I read your post just now that he wasn't American. I'm reminded of how shocked I was the first time I heard Idris Elba in an interview having only know him as Stringer Bell.
I didn't know he was in The Wire, only seen him in QAF. I really have to watch The Wire some day...
He was epic on The Wire, a great, great fit.
As a huge WIRE fan, I have to say this a pretty damn inspired choice.

"And he did it all with a Baltimore accent that was so convincing that I never doubted for a moment that he was American... and was startled to learn, when he first came in to read for Littlefinger, that he was actually Dublin born and presently lives in London."

Wow -- I had no idea he was Irish. He does a great American accent! Hey...McNulty's actually English, so maybe he could figure in here somewhere?

Sorry if the subject has been hit before, but it just occurred to me: what sort of accents will the characters be using in the show?  I never paid attention to the voices in my head while I was reading (har har), but you seem to be amassing a healthy variety of natural dialects.
comments.subject: Accents

comments.article:
More of a highly convincing generic East Coast accent than Baltimore (Balmer) accent, but either way it was still very convincing, and not everyone in Balmer, M'rlin' speaks with a full-blown Balmer accent, so it was fine. You probably have to be from there to be finely attuned to the differences.

I too assumed he was American until I saw him in an interview once and hear his natural accent (same with Dominick West and Idris Elba from that show).


Aiden Gillen was probably my own personal favorite choice for Littlefinger, so yeah, I'm very pleased with this casting.

Yes, Aidan himself said somewhere that they agreed NOT to try for a genuine Baltimore accent as it was so difficult to get right. He's always done very convincing US accents and he has the Queen's accent bang on.(Law and Order: Trial by Jury) In fact his Dublin accent is now nearly gone a lot of the time!
Holy crap, lol, I had no idea he was Irish.  LOVED him in The Wire!

Man I am so excited about all three of the new cast members.  Normally in a series I know, only one or two cast members even resemble what I picture them to be.  Almost everyone cast has been perfect!  I'm starting to wonder if the casting is based purely off of looks.  I'm joking but only slightly, I want the series to be great so badly.
comments.subject: casting too perfect?

comments.upictitle: Some Guy Named Paul's Comix: Group
comments.article: I was so happy when I heard about this! He's always been a favorite for Littlefinger.
This one really got me excited. :D

Definitely good news.
Just started watching the series Identity. Hope he gets a long run in both shows!
comments.subject: Identity

comments.article: Aidan is WAY too good looking for Littlefinger.  Aside from his excessive good looks, though, he's brilliant, so who cares :)  And with the fabulous makeup artist on staff Aidan can probably be less gorgeous!  Yay!  ...Errr, wait...
Was Littlefinger ever described as bad-looking? I always imagined him as kind of stylish, just too slimy to really be attractive. :P
All these little bits of casting info are making me so IMPATIENT! I wantz to watch.... NOW!
Perfect! Perfect! Wonderful!

This news has got me the most excited out of all the casting news! ^__^ They are doing such a GREAT job with the casting. It's making me more and more excited. And to have Aiden Gillen as Littlefinger... that's just icing on the cake. Icing made of pure awesome.

comments.upictitle: Grand Cato of Catos: Golden Dragon
comments.article: thats exactly how i pictured him. like a slimy grima wormtongue

Oh man, oh man oh man!! This is getting better and better!! I had no idea that Aidan was Irish either, his accent was spot on in The Wire.

I'm almost as excited for the show as I am for DOD! Almost. :)
